New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam with two outs in the bottom of the 10th inning
Jazz Chisholm gave the Yankees the lead in the 10th with a single, steal, and run
Anthony Volpe drove in the go-ahead run for the Yankees
Gerrit Cole had a strong outing, allowing no runs through 4 innings
Jack Flaherty had a strong outing, allowing no runs through 5 innings
Freddie Freeman legged out a triple on a misplay in left field by Alex Verdugo
Pre-Game Insights: The rivalry between the Dodgers and Yankees dates back to 1941
This World Series features five MVPs: Shohei Ohtani, Freddie Freeman, Mookie Betts, Aaron Judge, and Giancarlo Stanton
The game was dedicated to the memory of Fernando Valenzuela, who passed away earlier in the week
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed excitement about the walk-off grand slam
Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of a large and energetic crowd at Dodger Stadium
The Dodgers' Mookie Betts was seen getting ready for the game, discussing the importance of staying focused
